node.title: Regional NSW in flooding firing line, but some communities are spared the worst
node.alt: A group of people stand on the bank of a brown muddy river, next to a road bridge.
node.description: Another anxious night has passed for flood-affected residents of several regional NSW towns and rural areas, with residents of Singleton in the Hunter Valley counting their blessings after the Hunter River peaked lower than feared.
node.content:
["Another anxious night has passed for flood-affected residents of several regional NSW towns and rural areas.", "Locals in Singleton in the Hunter Valley are breathing a sigh of relief after the Hunter River peaked lower than feared.", "This morning, it had\u00a0edged up to 12.7 metres, below\u00a0the major flood level of 13 metres.\u00a0", "The State Emergency Service said there were no reports of property inundation or flood rescues, but large swathes of farmland had\u00a0been inundated and some roads cut off.", "Singleton resident John Atkins lives in a low lying property just metres from the swollen Hunter River and has lived in the area for more than 60 years.", "\"I wasn't too panicked,\" he said.", "\"The only thing I was worrying about was my cattle, but I got them all to higher ground, and I've got hay in the shed, and they're happy.\"", "", "
So far it's good news for Singleton residents, with the Hunter River staying below the major flood peak level.(ABC Upper Hunter: Jake Lapham)
", "Jeff Brown was surveying an inundated sports field in the cente of town on Sunday morning.", "\"It's not too bad I don't think, I've seen it worse,\" he said.", "It follows an evacuation order which was made by the State Emergency Service last night, for about\u00a02,000 people in\u00a0the\u00a0Whittingham, Scotts Flat, Glenridding, Dunolly and Combo areas around Singleton.", "Northern NSW also remains a concern, with the Namoi River still causing major flooding at\u00a0Wee Waa and Gunnedah.", "That river could cause moderate flooding at Narrabri this weekend.", "", "
The Castlereagh River at Gilgandra in full flow.(Supplied: Hayley Altmann)
", "
Western NSW remaining a focus
", "In Western NSW,\u00a0the Castlereagh River is continuing to rise.", "The SES said major flooding is likely at Coonamble from this morning, similar to the 2010 event. Moderate flooding was expected in Gilgandra from yesterday.", "Along the Macquarie River, moderate flooding is already occurring at Narromine and the downstream town of Warren can expect a major flood peak from tomorrow.", "Renewed rises of the Lachlan River have been observed at Cowra, which first experienced significant flooding two weeks ago.", "Levels have peaked at Jemalong, downstream of Forbes, and while slowly dropping, are still\u00a0above the major flood level.", "Moderate flooding is occurring at Condobolin.", "", "
The Castlereagh River at Gilgandra is one of many rivers flooding in NSW.(Supplied: Hayley Altmann)
", "Disaster assistance has been extended to more council areas following the past two weeks of devastation.", "Local government areas also now added to the initial declaration are Blayney, Brewarrina, Broken Hill, Cabonne, Cobar, Gilgandra, Gunnedah, Gwydir, Narrabri, Port Macquarie Hastings, Upper Hunter, Warrumbungle and Weddin.", "Tenterfield, Forbes, Bathurst, Blue Mountains, Cowra, Lachlan and Moree were already included."]
